snippet: Until more is done to strengthen the economy and job market, a college diploma is no guarantee of upward mobility.
abstract: Editorial argues that a college diploma no longer guarantees a good job or upward mobility; cites the fact that five successive graduating classes since 2007 have been greeted by high unemployment rates, trend that is likely to permanently depress their lifetime earnings and slow the economy as a whole.
lead_paragraph: Until more is done to strengthen the economy and job market, a college diploma is no guarantee of upward mobility.
